summary: Build a camera application with many features, cool filters, and support for video recording.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive Camera screen that requests camera permission, shows a live video preview, and supports switching between available cameras (front/back where supported) using the browser MediaDevices API.

Implement photo capture from the live preview and provide core capture tools: countdown timer (off/3s/10s), grid overlay toggle, mirror toggle (useful for front camera), and basic zoom control (use track constraints when supported; otherwise fallback to CSS scaling).

Add a Filters & Adjustments editor for captured photos with a non-trivial set of “cool” filters and adjustable parameters. Include at minimum: Original, Black & White, Sepia, Vintage Fade, Neon Pop, Cinematic (teal/orange), Blur, Sharpen, and Edge/Sketch. Provide intensity sliders and a live preview.

Provide creative tools on top of filters: crop with aspect ratio presets (1:1, 4:5, 16:9, free), rotate/flip, and a simple stickers/frames system (a small built-in set of vector/PNG stickers and 2–3 frames).

Implement an in-app Gallery that lists captured/edited photos, allows opening a photo to re-edit, supports delete, and supports export actions: download as PNG/JPEG (user selectable) with adjustable quality for JPEG.

Persist gallery items locally in the browser (IndexedDB or equivalent) so that photos remain available after refresh/reopen, and include storage management UI showing approximate space used and a “Clear all” option.

Connect frontend to the backend metadata endpoints so that when a user saves/exports an image locally, a metadata record is also created on the canister, and the Gallery can display metadata (filter name, date, dimensions).

Define and apply a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a modern “creative camera studio” experience, and enforce it consistently across Camera, Editor, and Gallery screens.
Add basic UX robustness: clear empty states, loading states for camera initialization, and error handling for unsupported browsers (no camera API), permission denial, and missing devices.
Add a simple onboarding/help modal that briefly explains: granting permission, switching camera, capturing, applying filters, saving/exporting, and where photos are stored (local browser storage).

Render generated static image assets (logo and subtle background) from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (e.g., app header logo and/or decorative background) without routing images through the backend.
Add a new "Beauty" effect in the Editor that makes the photo look whiter and smoother, with separate user controls for (1) skin smoothing and (2) whitening.
Implement a new "Mask" overlay feature in the Editor that lets the user place a decorative face-mask style PNG overlay on top of the photo with basic controls.
Refactor the canvas rendering pipeline so filters can accept additional parameters beyond a single intensity value (to support Beauty smoothing/whitening while keeping existing filters working).
Update the in-app Help modal copy to mention the new Beauty effect (whitening + smoothing) and the Mask overlay feature in clear English.
Add the required static mask overlay PNG assets to the project under frontend/public/assets/generated and load them directly from the frontend (no backend routing).

Update the Camera screen layout on small/mobile viewports to look cleaner and closer to a native phone camera experience by prioritizing a full-screen (or near full-screen) live preview with thumb-friendly overlay controls, while keeping the existing camera features (switch camera, timer, grid, mirror, zoom, gallery).

Adjust global app chrome for mobile camera usability by reducing distractions on the Camera screen (e.g., header/footer density and spacing) while preserving navigation and maintaining current behavior on larger screens.

Add a Video capture mode to the Camera screen that records video from the live camera preview using browser recording capabilities (e.g., MediaRecorder), with clear Start/Stop controls and recording state UI.
Persist recorded videos locally in the browser (IndexedDB or equivalent) alongside existing photos so that videos remain available after refresh/reopen, including storage size calculation updates.
Update the Gallery screen to support listing, previewing, and exporting recorded videos in addition to photos.
Update the in-app Help modal copy to mention how to record videos (switch to Video mode, start/stop recording, where videos are stored, and how to export them), in clear English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a camera app with many features and cool filters.

Add an optional backend feature to persist photo metadata (not required to store full image bytes): store records for saved photos containing id, createdAt, filename, format, dimensions, appliedFilter name, and adjustment parameters. Provide query endpoints to list records with pagination and delete by id.
Add a face mask/overlay filter and a beauty effect that makes the face look whiter and smoother (skin smoothing + whitening controls).
Improve the mobile-mode UI layout to look cleaner and more like a native phone camera app experience.
Add a video feature (record video from the live camera preview, with basic start/stop controls and saving/exporting).

projectName: Feature-rich Camera App with Cool Filters
